tweet: Notice how the scammers weren't asking for monero. They want bitcoin.

Notice that the hackers did not ask for a privacy coin like dash, monero or zcash, they asked for #bitcoin.   Why?   Because privacy coins are NOT private and even criminals don't find altcoins valuable enough to transact in.
In case you missed it the first time, we’ve added a ton of resources for businesses to begin accepting #Monero.  https://t.co/c0OpmKoGkA

@FrancisSully @mcnicollme @meier_bernhard @stephanlivera Bitcoin is a billion times easier to buy than Monero. It has a name that is instantly recognisable, where most of the people that saw the Tweets would never have heard of Monero. Bitcoin addresses are significantly shorter than Monero addresses, leading to more space in Tweets.

@chris_belcher_ @FrancisSully @mcnicollme @meier_bernhard @stephanlivera Ehhhh that's definitely not something that I've heard from many Monero fans. Ethereum fans, sure, and definitely from Ripple fans, but most Monero people know that it's not going to grow bigger than Bitcoin, and if Bitcoin fails then it takes everything down with it.

@mcnicollme @meier_bernhard @stephanlivera But the why is obvious. It's the same as loudly proclaiming that the hackers didn't ask for PayPal. We know why. It's not a vast secret that's been uncovered, or some clever view previously unknown. Even the biggest Monero proponent will be able to explain why.
Somebody sent the hacker a little tip with a message encoded in the extra outputs, telling them they should have used Monero  https://t.co/TYjPh7PSN3

Was the #TwitterHack the BEST HACKING followed by the WORST SCAM? 🤔  @fluffypony from @monero and @mrhartej join me to talk the power of #Twitter, the risks of being verified and the future of #Bitcoin  https://t.co/4cQMrdDmFs
XMR holders have 200 IQ and big PP.  https://t.co/10pTbTOHJ0

Holy shit someone sent a message in the transaction hashes to the scamming account saying "YOU TAKE RISK WHEN USE BITCOIN" "FOR YOUR TWITTER GAME" "BITCOIN IS TRACABLE" "WHY NOT MONERO" #TwitterHack #bitcoinscam  https://t.co/XsCrxOv1rI

"Decentralised" protocol raised money by selling tokens at a discount to insiders.  Welcome back to ICOs.  There is a very small field of competition for truly trustless and actually decentralised and capture resistant protocols.  BTC, DCR and XMR are the only contenders.

@fluffypony @FrancisSully @mcnicollme @meier_bernhard @stephanlivera In other words "the network effect is really strong". You say how its not a vast secret, but whenever I tell monero fans this they never engage and mutter something about myspace. So yes we DO need to keep repeating this. The network effect IS really strong.

Imagine how insecure you have to be to use this hack to say #Bitcoin is better than #Monero, when it has nothing to do with #Monero 😂  These people used a monumental breach to run a poorly designed scam, they’re obviously not the brightest.  #MaximalistsGettingNervous
Thankful for the opportunity to represent the #Monero community for this!  Hopefully answered some pressing questions for you all, and happy to do it again any time 😄
Do not send me Bitcoin if something happens to my account.  It’s obviously a scam because I would only accept XMR.

@AwakeningCat @cjtruth Purchasing with Bitcoin is as anonymous as using cash. Bitcoin transaction CAN be tracked and followed!!!   Hence why I think Silk Road will lead to MANY who used Bitcoin for nefarious reasons THINKING it was all anonymous.   You need privacy coins like Monero to stay anonymous.
